result.execSummary:
The defendant Valerie S Jacobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to share prescription drugs. No contact direct or indirect with SL.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through Petition by Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service for a non-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valerie S Jacobson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for DNA sample

Defendant Valerie S Jacobson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Valerie S Jacobson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz asks court to leave matter on the trial calendar for now, hopes case will resolve short of trial. Atty Reetz to let Court know by noon on 12/12/14 whether going to trial or not. Any pretrial motions to be filed by 12/05/14. Bond remains in effect.

Atty Reetz asks court to set matter for pretrial and trial with a hopes that matter resolves. Pretrial date set in court, set jury trial in December. Bond remains in effect.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Valerie S Jacobson in court with attorney Brett E. Reetz.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity.   Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on July 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to share medications. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. State will file Information and Discovery Demand later today.
